intro: Viguiera mucronata, commonly known as the Mexican heath or yellow coneflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. It has a compact, bushy growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Viguiera mucronata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
